artist: Artist: Utagawa Yoshikazu; Publisher: Izumiya Ichibei
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Written in box: {Nankin} (Nanking); poem by {Kanagaki Robun ki} (Kanagaki Robun); {Kono kuni hachijū-roku shū ni wakatsu. Sono shufu wo Paris to gō shi, Seine gawa no hotori ni ari. Jōmon jū-nana, machi ku nana hyaku sanjū ari. Funai jin\'en kushi no ha wo hikitari ga gotoku. Hyaku no ??? sonawara zaru mono nashi. Kosū san-man, jinkō rokujū-man. Kotowaza ni iwaku, France no jinmin wo Espania no uma no gotoshi to, kedashi sono kazu amata aru wo shōsan sareru(?) nari. Kokujin sakashiku, yoku hyaku ? wo benkyōsu. Onna no teisō tadashiku shite yōgan enrei nari.}
(This country consists of 86 provinces. The capital is called Paris, located by the Seine River. The city area is divided in 17 wards consisting of 730 blocks.The streets are crowded with so many houses and people coming and going all the time. The number of houses is about 30,000 with the 60,000 population. According to an old saying, Frenches are like Spanish horses, which means that they are admirable, because there are many of them(?). Generally, French people are smart and hard workers. French women are virtuous and physically attractive.)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From European Countries (Europe shū no uchi)
title: France
